reviews.text: It's not perfect, and the mix of comedy and suspense probably won't be for everyone, but for Yours Truly, it ended up being a very fun experience that had me on the edge of my seat most of the time. [Full review in Spanish].
reviews.author: Sebastian Zavala Kahn

reviews.text: Darkly funny, delightfully absurd, and shockingly gory, Ready or Not takes viewers on a thoroughly entertaining ride while commenting on privilege, class, and marriage.
reviews.author: Sameen Amer

reviews.text: …a super-smart B movie that offers a dark, splattery note on the margins of society’s growing divisions….
reviews.author: Eddie Harrison

reviews.text: The set up of Ready Or Not sounds clunky, and it kind of is. The execution though, is peerless.
reviews.author: Noah Berlatsky

reviews.text: As a kind of grown-up Clue in reverse, complete with the tribute appearance of a pepper-box revolver, Ready or Not also lays out a motley assortment of Colonel Mustard and Mrs. Peacock-worthy opponents hell-bent on dispatching Grace prior to sun-up.
reviews.author: Greg Carlson

reviews.text: Ready or Not accomplishes exactly what it set out to do. It delivers a fun, entertaining 90-minute hide-and-seek game as we’ve never seen before.
reviews.author: Manuel São Bento

reviews.text: A beautiful and fun exercise of cat and mouse. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: A vein of social commentary on class and marriage runs through the cat-and-mouse hunt before building to a cathartic ending.
reviews.author: Jennifer Bisset

reviews.text: Ready or Not is another solid film for 2019. It’s secured a place in my top five of the year and probably will stay somewhere around there.
reviews.author: Kate Boyle

reviews.text: While much horror of late is thin allegory for the political landscape or the class divide, the wealthy doofuses in this film don't represent anything or anyone more than the backdrop to an enjoyable and rewatchable fright-lite.
reviews.author: Cris Kennedy

reviews.text: Ready or Not brings a new twist to the familiar story of trying to impress your soon-to-be in-laws by combining horror, mystery, and a little bit classic screwball comedy
reviews.author: Amanda Mazzillo

reviews.text: Ready Or Not blends horror and comedy effortlessly to give the audience a great viewing experience.
reviews.author: Britany Murphy

reviews.text: It's the kind of low-budget, bound-for-cult-glory movie whose eccentricities will grow on you with repeated viewings.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: A darkly hilarious new entry in the ever-expanding cinema of discontent inspired by the one percenters and Donald Trump.
reviews.author: Frederick Blichert

reviews.text: The gorier, gushier, nastier cousin to Knives Out...
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: Episode 48: Ready or Not / It Chapter Two / Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown
reviews.author: Taylor Baker

reviews.text: The intrigue propels you more than the execution of the concept... but I think if you go see this one a good time will be had by all.
reviews.author: Lonita Cook

reviews.text: Witty, with enough twists and shocks to keep it interesting, Ready or Not has the same class warfare foundation that made Get Out and Parasite so oddly satisfying.
reviews.author: Alex Behan

reviews.text: Once the story finds its feet this is an entertaining back-and-forth blend of horror and comedy.
reviews.author: Grant Watson

reviews.text: It's not trying to reinvent the wheel or subvert any kind of genre expectations, but it's still a hell of a gory and entertaining ride.
reviews.author: Nicolás Delgadillo

reviews.text: There are only so many clever gags the filmmakers can include before it becomes obvious they're trying to cover up holes of their own making.
reviews.author: Alex Bentley

reviews.text: Ready or Not provides a new take on the slasher-in-a-mansion model; a little muddled at times, but thoroughly fun.
reviews.author: Alix Turner

reviews.text: A crowd-pleaser with some laughs and a giddily gory climax.
reviews.author: Richard Crouse

reviews.text: Ready or Not's B-movie thrills and kills are sure to guarantee at least a passably good time.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Zhang

reviews.text: Devilish fun with a tour de force lead performance from breakout star Samara Weaving.
reviews.author: Trace Thurman

reviews.text: A remarkably strong ending fixes many of the storyline and pacing issues.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: What elevates this above other genre entries is its biting social commentary as it mercilessly skewers the 1% and the lengths they go to attain and maintain their wealth.
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: One of the biggest surprises of 2019, this was a horror film with some edgy humor inserted inside the usual "one night to survive or die" plot construction.
reviews.author: Dan Buffa

reviews.text: This 2019 horror comedy is a completely unexpected gem that puts a real sinister twist on a childhood game. Full of witty humor and tense drama, thanks to its well-balanced script, Ready or Not is surely set for cult status.
reviews.author: Jordy Sirkin

reviews.text: It's as horrifying as it is hilarious.
reviews.author: Matthew St. Clair

reviews.text: Ready or Not may not play with convention as successfully as it clearly has a desire to, but for the most part it is a suitably gnarly and surprisingly funny ride that very much knows what tone it is wanting to strike.
reviews.author: Andrew Gaudion

reviews.text: Shotgun wedding takes on a new meaning.
reviews.author: Jason Best

reviews.text: It plays to the rafters with its punch-the-air gore and casts Weaving as one of the most rootable protagonists in the genre's recent past.
reviews.author: Tom Beasley

reviews.text: Gore-filled mayhem ensues in this unexpectedly awesome Halloween treat. There's a hint of Uma Thurman's Kill Bill ass-kicking fury as a lace-dressed Grace fights back, and a whole stack of gross out special effects as things get ultra vicious
reviews.author: Stephen A. Russell

reviews.text: I'm not moved by the gore or the slapstick humor used by those characters who celebrate the ritual of brutality. The narrative lacks intensity. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: Sometimes you watch a trailer so bonkers that you go into the movie expecting it to be awesomely bad. Then, as you sit and watch the movie itself, you realize that you actually underestimated the filmmakers.
reviews.author: Jason Fraley

reviews.text: Nutty, nerve-shredding and fiendish fast-paced fun throughout.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: Co-Directors Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett cleverly infused both horror and comedy into this wickedly fun treat.
reviews.author: Allie Loukas

reviews.text: The pitch-black humor cuts through like a knife, where mayhem and viciousness are both played for shock and laughs.
reviews.author: Allen Almachar

reviews.text: It finds the appropriate balance where it's deadly serious while simultaneously having its tongue firmly planted in cheek, all while moving at a brisk pace.
reviews.author: Damond Fudge

reviews.text: Simply one of the best times I had at a movie theater this year.
reviews.author: Brent McKnight

reviews.text: It was a good theater-going experience.
reviews.author: Avaryl Halley

reviews.text: It was crazy... I enjoyed this.
reviews.author: Andrew Galdi

reviews.text: Shamelessly entertaining, but very stupid.
reviews.author: Shawn Edwards

reviews.text: A madcap cat-and-mouse game that's exhilaratingly fun...and offers a darkly funny and satirical take on just how ridiculous the rich really are.
reviews.author: Laura Di Girolamo

reviews.text: Weaving comes alive as a hilarious and deeply macabre play on the "final girl" archetype, and it's nothing short of cathartic to cheer her on and echo the rage that quickly consumes and empowers her.
reviews.author: Cody Corrall

reviews.text: Not many movies can have you laughing at one minute & biting your nails at another Ready Or Not does. It is the perfect combination of horror & humor. A wild & fun ride!
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: Ready or Not is remarkably successful at hitting its own sweet spot for such a modest movie.
reviews.author: Jorge Ignacio Castillo

reviews.text: Most impressively, the movie effortlessly balances its slasher suspense with an acid-tongued humor, keeping the film from feeling like a parody.
reviews.author: Marshall Estes

reviews.text: Be prepared to have a new favourite to add to your midnight movie collection.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: Ready or Not is such a fun movie for the late summer. Perfectly balancing dark comedy and slasher horror in a new way.
reviews.author: Julian Lytle

reviews.text: Another year, another handful of overhyped horror films that don't live up to their potential.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: It presents a fascinating setup with a childhood game that turns into a deadly hunt, giving you a few good thrills and darkly-humorous moments along the way, but unfortunately Busick and Murphy's screenplay doesn't do quite enough with the premise.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: Heir to De Palma's best horror. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Paula Vázquez Prieto

reviews.text: Ready or Not combines humor and murder to create a deliciously wonderful film and brought a surprise hit with critical acclaim to movie theaters this summer.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: Prepare to laugh, suffer and not take your eyes off of it. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: Part of the fun is understanding the family dynamic despite meeting them under heightened circumstances.
reviews.author: Brian Collins

reviews.text: Ready or Not builds upon a woman's fear of not being accepted by her in-laws and laughs about the situation through a black horror comedy, concocting a satisfying bloody feast. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Laura Pacheco Mora

reviews.text: It's wildly entertaining and at a tight 90 minutes, it crackles with energy, never letting your attention waver.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: As the bungling archetypes run riot within the mansion, it's clear that this is a horror that knows its strengths and undeniably operates best in its more playful moments. The result is loads of bloody fun.
reviews.author: Toby Woollaston

reviews.text: Ready or Not is a nasty little bit of exploitation satire in the tradition of Little Shop of Horrors, and I'm frankly surprised at how much I enjoyed it.
reviews.author: Chris McCoy

reviews.text: Ready or Not does exactly what you want it to.
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: It's never easy creating something fresh within the well-worn horror genre but Ready or Not deserves praise for its cool concept.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: The result is thrilling, playful, and always pleasant. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Antonio Trashorras

reviews.text: Ready or Not heralds the arrival of a fantastic talent in Samara Weaving, as well as directors Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett.
reviews.author: Sean Fallon

reviews.text: Ready or Not is a joyously fun time that ensures that Radio Silence are filmmakers to be reckoned with and cements Samara Weaving as a bona fide star. Recommended.
reviews.author: Harris Dang

reviews.text: Ready or Not is a stupendously chilling, riveting and crazy horror.
reviews.author: Ben Rolph

reviews.text: A goof and a hoot, a retro, completely silly, quite violent but never nasty romp that doesn't tax the cerebral cortex but isn't without style ... Weaving is supremely watchable, a superb physical comedienne with a unique presence.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: [Samara Weaving] faces an uphill slog, hampered by a creaky plot, cookie-cutter supporting characters and plodding direction.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: A lively horror/thriller with a great grindhouse feel but it comes perilously close to forgetting to just have fun. Once it finally lets its hair down, it's a damn good time.
reviews.author: Tim Martain

reviews.text: It's neither witty enough to be truly, viciously funny, nor sufficiently scary to cultivate the atmosphere of evil that might make it genuinely unnerving.
reviews.author: Luke Goodsell

reviews.text: Even by its own humble standards the plot is poorly worked out (a few lame attempts at social commentary criticising the rich are feeble in the extreme) and the dialogue is wretched.
reviews.author: David Stratton

reviews.text: There's no attempt to be seriously disturbing, or to offer us anything more than a macabre good time. Still, on that level the film delivers.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: Think of Meet the Parents as re-imagined by Stephen King and you'll get some idea of what to buckle yourself in for with the twisted, bizarre offerings in this knockout horror-comedy, skillfully directed with a terrific balance of laughs, scares and gore.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: A round of hide and seek with some blue bloods gets, well, bloody in the very funny horror-satire Ready or Not.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: Bloody, twisted, and hilarious, Ready or Not is an absolute treat as both a fresh offering for horror fans and cinema in general for 2019.
reviews.author: Peter Gray

reviews.text: Samara Weaving is a one-woman firestorm, blazing her way through a crumbling house of cards.
reviews.author: Andiee Paviour

reviews.text: With lashings of blood and plenty of giddy thrills, 'Ready or Not' is one game you'll want to play again and again.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: One of the most entertaining films of the year. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: It lacks cruelty to be truly dark when it is nothing more than light gray, but its last 20 minutes are truly stupendous. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Javier Ocaña

reviews.text: Thrilling, hilarious and fun for all the family (jk, don't bring kids to this, unless you want them to turn into freaky murderous children).
reviews.author: Deirdre Molumby

reviews.text: Highly entertaining and full of blood! [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: David Ocadiz

reviews.text: A very enjoyable film, unable to bore. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ignacio Navarro

reviews.text: It's silly subversive fun - it just could have sought out more smarts.
reviews.author: Roe McDermott

reviews.text: Ready or Not puts the fun back into horror.
reviews.author: Liam De Brùn

reviews.text: Maybe the elements are not particularly new, but this festival of blood and gags is very well built and it's enjoyable from beginning to end. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Batlle

reviews.text: A blast of entertainment, fun and ingenuity. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Janire Zurbano

reviews.text: A charming film that plays well with references to the genre. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: John Tones

reviews.text: It wouldn't work as well as it does if not for Samara Weaving as Grace. She the kind of face you look for in a scream queen, but also that unkillable spirit, which is put to the test.
reviews.author: Eli Glasner

reviews.text: Ready or Not is a vehicle to entertain, to mock the elite, instead of adding something new to the genre. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Israel Acosta Aroche

reviews.text: All in all, Ready or Not is a diverting, fun romp through the worst wedding ever.
reviews.author: Amanda Greever

reviews.text: Laugh-out-loud moments with slight revulsion...rather than running out of steam, it keeps picking up pace and cracking along.
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: New Scream Queen on the chopping block Samara Weaving (niece of Hugo) holds the murderous aristocratic mayhem together, while Andie MacDowell and company prove good sports by entering into the filthy-rich and gory spirit of the rigorous gross-outs.
reviews.author: Alan Jones

reviews.text: Directed by Tyler Gillett and Matt Bettinelli-Olpin, the film does nothing fresh with its scenes of tension and violence, but they're pretty entertaining, and some of the added touches of black comedy are excellent.
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: Weaving's spirited performance and a game cameo from Andie MacDowell help leaven the bloody, tongue-in-cheek carnage.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: So while this low-brow approach is entertaining, it's missing a trick to make things even more punchy by actually being scary while grappling with topics that are already sitting here unexplored.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Ready or Not takes great pleasure in setting up and paying off obvious gags and gore, then switching things up with a sharp take that keeps things creepy and intelligent throughout.
reviews.author: Alex Goldstein

reviews.text: There is an elegance to the premise - an otherwise straightforward cat-and-mouse chase around a gothic mansion - and a satisfying clip to the rewardingly gory action.
reviews.author: Simran Hans

reviews.text: Fleet, funny, and gleefully bloodthirsty.
reviews.author: Adam Lubitow

reviews.text: [A] witty, endlessly suspenseful US slasher movie that critiques privilege and entitlement.
reviews.author: Charlotte O'Sullivan

reviews.text: Weaving is nothing short of a revelation - goofy, beautiful, ballsy and very funny - a cosplayer's dream character.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: [A] delicious romp with a game heroine that never takes itself too seriously, and has some pointed things to say about the class system.
reviews.author: Ed Potton

reviews.text: Think the Addams family, only less appealing.
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: A completely funny satire about the upper class, the rules imposed by society and even marriage. So if you want to have a great time with blood and guaranteed laughter, run and watch Ready or Not. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Abigail Camarillo

reviews.text: guarantees a gory good time
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: There's little nuance in Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett's horror-comedy take on class warfare, but it's Weaving's touch of pure anger that makes it feel like more than just your average shlocky gorefest.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: [Ready or Not] mixes its influences in a refreshingly intelligent and often times subversive way. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Fernando Galván

reviews.text: Co-starring Adam Brody and Andie MacDowell, what follows is all kinds of grizzly fun, with the hilarious twist-ending the cherry on the top.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: Ready Or Not manages to successfully cram in incisive social commentary, deliciously gory thrills and terrific gags, and that is a triumph all on its own. More like this, please.
reviews.author: Patrick Sproull

reviews.text: It's not pretty, but it's bloody good fun.
reviews.author: Tim Robey

reviews.text: Ready or Not is fast-moving, ridiculous, scary and absurd all at once.
reviews.author: Alexa Dalby

reviews.text: Much blood is spilt and many quips are made as the absurdities pile up, although it never really adds up to all that much.
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: [A] black comedy-thriller that blows up in your face, not once but regularly.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: Directors Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett have a lot of fun with the bloody set-pieces and moments of high tension and the cast is clearly having a brilliant time finding the humour and horror.
reviews.author: Jonathan Hatfull

reviews.text: Not subtle (and might put you off getting hitched), but hits its mark with baseball-bat force.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: Fun, funny, gory, and with enough twists and turns to keep us on our toes, this is the definition of a bloody blast.
reviews.author: Joey Keogh

reviews.text: Ready or Not is your premiere summer slasher with plenty of substance to go around.
reviews.author: Abygai Pena

reviews.text: No-fat fun and a great new scream queen in Samara Weaving.
reviews.author: Elena Lazic

reviews.text: Ultraviolent satire is forgettable but fun for horror fans.
reviews.author: Joyce Slaton

reviews.text: It helps that Samara Weaving is fantastic in the lead, fully committed to the darker aspects and with impeccable comic timing.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

synopsis: Grace couldn't be happier after she marries the man of her dreams at his family's luxurious estate. There's just one catch -- she must now hide from midnight until dawn while her new in-laws hunt her down with guns, crossbows and other weapons. As Grace desperately tries to survive the night, she soon finds a way to turn the tables on her not-so-lovable relatives.
